page.syntax: V <ARRAY>.move(from as N, to as N [, elems as N])

argument.name: from
argument.description: The current position of the element being moved.

argument.name: to
argument.description: The new position of the element being moved.

argument.name: elems
argument.description: The number of elements to move. Default value is 1.

page.description: Move an array entry from one position to another.
page.discussion: The <ARRAY>.MOVE() method moves an element in a single dimensional array From the specified position specified To the specified position.

section.title: Example
section.description: Consider an array defined as follows:
section.example: dim A[5] as C A[1] = "Orange" A[2] = "Banana" A[3] = "Apple" A[4] = "Pineapple" A[5] = "Mango"

section.title: Moving Multiple Entries
section.description: The third parameter can be used to specify the number of elements to move. EG:
section.example:
dim A[10] as C A[1] = "Orange" A[2] = "Banana" A[3] = "Apple" A[4] = "Pineapple" A[5] = "Mango"
? A = [1] = "Orange" [2] = "Banana" [3] = "Apple" [4] = "Pineapple" [5] = "Mango" [6] = "" [7] = "" [8] = "" [9] = "" [10] = ""
A.MOVE(2,7,3) ? A = [1] = "Orange" [2] = "Mango" [3] = "" [4] = "" [5] = "Banana" [6] = "Apple" [7] = "Pineapple" [8] = "" [9] = ""
